contextId.information: Here the word "letter" means letters of the alphabet and refers to words that people write down. The phrase alludes to the Old Testament law. AT: "a covenant not based on commands that men have written" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: a covenant not of the letter

contextId.information: Here the word "heart" refers to the emotions. This means that God caused Titus to love them. AT: "who made Titus care for you as much as I do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: who put into Titus' heart the same earnest care that I have for you
